title: Update regarding LuxeBrands
story_body:
SUPPLY CHAIN CONSTRAINTS IMPACT CONSUMER CYCLICAL SECTOR; LUXEBRANDS AMONG AFFECTED COMPANIES

NEW YORK, January 15, 2024, 14:30 EST - The consumer cyclical sector is experiencing widespread supply chain disruptions affecting multiple companies, including LuxeBrands Inc. (NASDAQ: LUXE), according to industry reports released Tuesday.

Manufacturing delays and logistics bottlenecks have created inventory shortages across the sector, impacting companies' ability to meet consumer demand during the current quarter. The disruptions stem from port congestion, container shortages, and extended lead times for raw materials.

LuxeBrands Inc. confirmed it is experiencing supply chain constraints consistent with broader industry conditions. The company stated that delivery timelines for certain product categories have extended by four to six weeks compared to historical averages.

Industry analysts report that consumer cyclical companies are facing elevated freight costs and reduced container availability on key shipping routes. These conditions have persisted since late 2023 and show limited signs of near-term resolution.

The situation affects various product categories within the consumer cyclical sector, including apparel, footwear, accessories, and home goods. Multiple companies have reported inventory levels below optimal ranges for the current selling period.

Port authorities in Los Angeles and Long Beach reported container processing times increased by 35 percent compared to the prior year period. Similar delays have been documented at East Coast facilities, creating nationwide distribution challenges.

LuxeBrands Inc. operates 247 retail locations and maintains an e-commerce platform. The company has not issued revised financial guidance at this time. Management indicated it is working with suppliers and logistics partners to mitigate disruptions where possible.

The consumer cyclical sector index declined 2.3 percent in morning trading Tuesday, reflecting investor concerns about supply chain impacts on revenue and margins across affected companies.

Industry trade groups have documented similar supply chain challenges affecting competitors throughout the sector. No specific timeline has been established for resolution of the current constraints.

LuxeBrands Inc. shares traded at $42.15 as of 14:00 EST Tuesday, down $1.23 from the previous close. Trading volume exceeded the 30-day average by 18 percent.

The company is scheduled to report fourth quarter results on February 28, 2024.
